intro: Eatonia glabra, commonly known as the smooth eatonia, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
